data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you take 10 steps forward. If you always face left, take 10 steps forward. If you always face right, take 9 steps right. If you always take 10 steps backward, take 10 steps backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around has to be done as far as possible ahead. You cannot get to the starting point if you are already there. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around, you will be at the starting point. If you return to the starting point, you will walk 2 way. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take one step. Take one step. Take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and take 5 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around. Turn around. Turn around. Turn left. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you repeat the steps 8 times, you will go straight for 9 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
When you take 6 steps, you are already on your way to going back to the starting point. If you turn around and take 8 steps, you take 2 steps as well. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person facing forward will always take 1 step left. While facing forward always face forward, the person who takes 1 step to the right will take 5 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 3 steps and turn around you got 9 steps back to the very beginning. If you take 2 steps and turn around you got 7 steps back to the very beginning. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step downward. Take 1 step forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You always take 6 steps backward in the order of facing forward. You also always take 8 steps right in the order of facing right. You also always take 5 steps left in the order of facing left.. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can always take 5 steps right. You can always take 6 steps left. You can always take 3 steps forward. You can always take 4 steps right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person facing to the left can get one step left. A person facing to the right can get 2 steps left. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you usually won’t take 1 step backwards. If you always face forward with your eyes closed, this will invariably keep you from moving forward. If you ever take a step backward, you will be brought back to where you started. If you ever take a step forward, you will be taken to where you started. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 8 steps. Turn right. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn left. Take 8 steps. Turn around. Take right. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take right. Take 4 steps.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To go back the way you came, start from the beginning by taking 6 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 7 steps on the first line and turn around and back around. Turn right on the second line and turn around and back around. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
All steps should lead to the same starting point and turn around. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you go back 5 steps to the step you began, you would be back at the beginning of the process. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 1 step, take 2 steps, take 3 steps and turn left. You take 6 steps in total. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
For each statement, you will be returning to the starting point. The answer: Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Let’s say the starting point is a chair. The starting point is 4 steps away from where you started. If you walk back to the chair, you’ll take 10 steps to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

To go backwards from forward, one usually has to take 5 steps backward and facing forward. In addition, the instructions also mention that one could also take 4 moves back, but only 1 back, and so on. Thus, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Steps must always be taken forwards. Backward takes 7 steps. Left takes 9 steps. To go backward requires 9 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To return the starting point, you go around that point and walk 4 steps back. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One should always face backwards if one is to be safe. There is no way to get back to a starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
This is to turn around from the left. To return to the starting point, you want to take 5 steps to turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
After facing forward, you can walk backwards, go forward and face forward as usual. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 1 step. The number of steps in the original command would equal the number of steps in the original command. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Then you walk back in 6 ohms. The answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Just like you cannot reverse the directions, there are only 2 ways to get back to either direction and they are opposite. Take a second to repeat the instructions again. Taking 3 or 6 steps back then repeat the instructions. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Turn around. Turn around. Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It takes 1 step to return to the starting point. However, turning around means you’re turning around all of a sudden. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you can always take 5 steps backward. If you always face forward, you can not take 4 steps backward. If you always take 9 steps forward, you can always take 9 steps forward. Therefore, the answer is No.

You always face forward when you take the above instructions. You can always return to your starting point. So, the answer is yes.

The first instruction is for the people to assume that they are in the start position. The last instruction requires the people to believe that they are the last position. So, the answer is No.

You cannot turn around using two steps. You can not turn around using 8 steps. So, the answer is No.

After 4 steps forward, you take 6 steps forward. After 9 steps forward, take 9 steps backward. Whenever you are faced forward, they are four steps forward and a backward step. So, the answer is Yes.

If you repeat these steps multiple times, you’ll get to the starting point at one of the time increments. Take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

You take 3 steps to the left to backtrack. Take 4 steps backward to go to front of you. Take 8 steps backward and repeat.

Step 1: A person goes forward while facing a backwards direction. Step 2: A person goes backward while facing a forward direction. Step 3: A person goes forward while facing a forward direction. Step 4: A person goes backward while facing a forward direction. So, the answer is No.

You may take 10 steps to go around. This requires 10 steps +10 steps = 30 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you always face forward, you can return to the starting point in one step. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first step right is on the left. If you always face forward, there is no need to take any extra steps. The last step left is in the opposite direction as you were facing forward. The first step forward is on the left. An extra step right isn’t required. So, the answer is no.

Take 6 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 4 steps right. Take 4 steps left. Take 8 steps left. Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. The answer is No.

Turn left and then take 3 steps to turn right. To return to the starting point, you need to take an additional 9 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps right. Take 9 steps left. Take 5 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

On any given day, you’ll start with facing forward. If you always face forward, you stay aware of your right and left spots. If you always face left, you stay nearer to your right and left spots and stay on your right side. In total, this leaves you with 9 steps left and 5 steps left, all of which don’ t leave you with any room to move. Therefore, the answer is No.

When facing forward, you always try to take two steps forward. When facing backward, you usually take five steps backwards instead of four. So, the answer is No.

Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Facing forward you can only take 10 steps backwards, and you can take 10 steps forwards only. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The instructions call for you to always face forward. As you go 4 steps forward, you take 4 steps forward. Towards the top of the screen reads, Take 4 steps forward. In this way, a person begins to get used to facing upward. In this way, if you are facing inward, you will take 4 steps forward along with 4 steps forward. The final answer: Yes.
